meanings.definition: Fail to fire or discharge properly.
meanings.sent1: The old car engine kept misfiring during the race.
meanings.sent2: The faulty spark plug caused the engine to misfire frequently.
meanings.sent3: The misfiring grill made cooking burgers a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her misfiring attempts at humor fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The misfiring fireworks lit up the night sky with sporadic bursts.

meanings.definition: To fail to function effectively or as expected.
meanings.sent1: The plan started misfiring as soon as it was put into action.
meanings.sent2: The new software update caused the system to misfire constantly.
meanings.sent3: His misfiring memory led to some hilarious mix-ups.
meanings.sent4: The misfiring communication between the teams resulted in chaos.
meanings.sent5: The misfiring clock made everyone late for the meeting.
